availability.p: All research and writing of Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition annotations was undertaken by project staff, volunteers, and interns. Each record contains citations to relevant primary and secondary source material. All annotations are copyright Kentucky Historical Society, and should be referenced as such in any published work.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition

person.persName: Richard H. George (Shelby County, KY, farmer and soldier)

body.p: Shelby County, Kentucky, farmer. Shelby County, Kentucky native. Son of Lindsay George and Elizabeth Young George. Married to Mollie R. Garris George in Shelby County on November 10, 1854. Farmer in Shelby County in 1860. Owned eight enslaved persons in Shelby County in 1860. Served in the Shelby County State Guard as captain from September 1, 1862, to November 1, 1862.

ab.bibl:
Eighth Manuscript Census of the United States (1860), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Shelby County, District 1, p. 181.
Eighth Manuscript Census of the United States (1860), Slave Schedules, Kentucky, Shelby County, District 1, p. 258B.
Kentucky Birth, Marriage and Death Records – Microfilm (1852-1910), KDLA, Roll #994054, Shelby County Marriages, p. 4.
Report of the Adjutant General of the State of Kentucky, vol. 2, 1861-1866 (Frankfort: Kentucky Yeoman Office, 1867), 856.
Vital Statistics Original Death Certificates – Microfilm (1911-1964), KDLA, Roll #7016182, Shelby County Deaths, File #6095.
